page.title: 03Bottor Rock and Beacon Lane
page.content: BOTTOR ROCK AND BEACON LANE BEACON LANE IS A FORMER PACKHORSE LANE AND IS FOUR HUNDRED YEARS OLD . THE LOCAL SCHOOL IN HENNOCK ARE USING IT AS PART OF THEIR GREEN LANE PROJECT WHICH INVOLVES HISTORY, GEOGRAPHY,CONSERVATION AND SCIENCE. AT THE MOMENT IT IS NOT USED VERY MUCH EXCEPT BY YOUNGSTERS WHO USE IT FOR SCRAMBLING WITH THEIR MOTOR BIKES.THERE ARE SOME COPSE OF TREES BUT ALL THE OLD ELMS HAVE DIED DUE TO DUTCH ELM DISEASE . THE MAJORITY OF THE TREES ARE SYCAMORE, HAZEL AND BEECH. WILD LIFE ABOUNDS BADGERS, SQUIRRELS, FOXES AND RABBITS. THE CHILDREN ARE KEEPING SECRET THE EXISTENCE OF THE BADGER SETTS BECAUSE OF THE MINISTRY OF AGRICULTRES POLICY OF POISONING THEM BECAUSE OF BOVINE T.B.
